subject: Career
title: The Stanford Remote Work Experiment
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Stanford Remote Work Experiment.

hook.text: Nick Bloom ran the first rigorous remote work experiment. The results shocked the business world.

buildup.text: In 2013, Ctrip let half its call center work from home. Performance jumped 13%.

discovery.text: Remote workers took fewer breaks, had fewer sick days, and reported higher job satisfaction.

twist.text: But 50% of home workers eventually chose to return. Loneliness and career invisibility were the reasons.

climax.text: The experiment proved remote work boosts productivity but requires solving isolation and visibility.

punchline.text: Remote work works. But it works best with intentional design.

quiz.question: What did Nick Bloom's Stanford experiment find about remote work?
options: Performance increased 13% but loneliness was a challenge
